item.title: Sweeping US defense bill passes, with Ukraine, Venezuela provisions defying Trump
item.description:
By Patricia Zengerle

WASHINGTON, Dec 17 (Reuters) - The U.S. Senate voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday to advance a $901 billion bill setting policy for the ​Pentagon, sending the massive piece of legislation to the White House, ​which has said President Donald Trump will sign it into law.

item.title: Israel's Netanyahu approves $35B natural gas megadeal with Egypt
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced Israel will sell Egypt natural gas worth $35 billion, in the biggest-ever deal of its kind for the country.

item.title: Qatar’s prime minister meets US officials as Gaza plan stalls
item.description: Sheikh Mohammed's visit comes as questions mount over Hamas' disarmament and the role of international troops in post-war Gaza.

item.title: UN chief Guterres urges maximum restraint in Yemen after separatist advance
item.description:
UNITED NATIONS, ​Dec 17 (Reuters) - ​United Nations ⁠Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday urged ​all parties ‍in Yemen ​to exercise maximum restraint after an ⁠advance by southern separatists that risks rekindling a 10-year-old civil war ​after ⁠a ⁠long lull.

He also said the operating environment had ‌become untenable ​in the areas held by the Iran-aligned ‍Houthi movement - Yemen's capital ‌Sanaa and ‌the heavily populated northwest.

(Reporting by Michelle Nichols, editing ⁠by David Ljunggren)

item.title: Over 600 Israeli ex-security chiefs urge Trump to disarm Hamas, back PA in Gaza
item.description: Former Israeli security and diplomatic officials, members of Commanders for Israel’s Security, sent a letter to President Trump urging him to disarm Hamas and involve the Palestinian Authority in the second phase of his Gaza peace plan.

item.title: Syria foils major arms smuggling attempt to Lebanon: What we know
item.description: Syrian authorities have stepped up operations targeting smuggling attempts mainly destined for Hezbollah in Lebanon since the fall of President Bashar al‑Assad’s regime last year.

item.title: Iran boxer sentenced to death at 'imminent' risk of execution: rights groups
item.description:
An Iranian boxer sentenced to death on charges of membership of an outlawed group is at imminent risk of execution after his request for a retrial was rejected, rights groups and the exiled opposition said on Wednesday.

The World Boxing Council and sporting luminaries including former tennis star Martina Navratilova have called on Iran to spare the life of Mohammad Javad Vafaei-Sani, 30, a silver medallist in the national boxing championship.

item.title: Explainer-What's next for the Gaza ceasefire and will the truce last?
item.description:
Dec 17 - More than two months after Israel and Hamas agreed a ceasefire halting two years of devastating warfare in Gaza, most fighting has stopped.

However, both ​sides accuse each other of major breaches of the deal and look no closer ​to accepting the much more difficult steps envisaged for the next phase.

WHAT HAVE THEY AGREED TO?

Ceasefire steps are outlined in three different documents.
